intro: Orophea sichaikhanii, commonly known as the Sichai Khankhan palm, is a rare and unique species native to the western Himalayas. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its large, fan-shaped leaves and distinctive inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female structures, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Orophea sichaikhanii is considered a vulnerable species.
